Description: Introduce a human-facing UI and practical workflows for SOE, plans, compliance, and approvals without expanding execution scope.
Create a basic frontend application (Next.js or similar) with routing, layout, and API client setup.
Initialize frontend app with routing, basic layout, and environment config.
Create typed API client for Datum backend endpoints.
Add toast or banner error handling for API failures.
Allow users to run SOE evaluations from the UI.
Form for industry, hardware class, inputs, and profile/bundle selection.
Display SOE decisions, active packs, and profile stack used.
Warn if identical inputs would regenerate an identical SOE run.
Generate and view Datum plans from SOE runs.
List plans with state, version, approval status.
View steps, sequence, locked fields, and source rules.
Visually mark SOE-locked steps vs editable steps.
Enable safe, governed plan edits from the UI.
Allow editing only permitted fields on unlocked steps.
Show before/after diff prior to saving changes.
Surface backend validation errors clearly.
Support submit/approve/reject flows in the UI.
Allow plan submission with comments.
Approve/reject UI with justification input.
Display approval events and users.
Expose compliance trace and standards stack visually.
Display BASE/DOMAIN/CUSTOMER profiles and order.
Click a step to see required clauses and sources.
Highlight steps with overrides or deviations.
Allow users to generate and view compliance reports.
Trigger compliance report generation from UI.
Display HTML compliance report inside the UI.
Show report hash, plan version, profile stack.
Add minimal auth scaffolding to distinguish roles (viewer/editor/approver).
Hardcoded or mock roles for now (no real auth provider).
Hide/show actions based on role.
Ensure frontend cannot bypass backend governance.
UI must not present actions backend will reject.
Ensure UI cannot submit illegal edits or approvals.
